snippet: A proposal that reinstates Utah’s use of firing squads to carry out executions narrowly passed a crucial vote Friday in the state’s Legislature after three missing lawmakers were summoned to break a tie.
abstract: Utah's Republican-controlled State House votes to reinstate use of firing squads in executions; neither State Senate nor Gov Gary Herbert, also Republican, have said if they will pass or sign bill.
lead_paragraph: A proposal that reinstates Utah’s use of firing squads to carry out executions narrowly passed a crucial vote Friday in the state’s Legislature after three missing lawmakers were summoned to break a tie.

headline.main: Utah: House Votes to Reinstate Death by Firing Squad
headline.print_headline: Utah: House Votes to Reinstate Death by Firing Squad
